actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: A bill to amend Public Law 874 of the 81st Congress to create within the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare a National Overseas Education Board having responsibility for the elementary and secondary education of certain overseas dependents.
subjects: Department of Health, Education, and Welfare

summary.text: National Overseas Education Act - Creates within the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare a National Overseas Education Board of eight members to be appointed by the President. Specifies that the Board shall have full and complete responsibility for the maintenance and operation of elementary and secondary schools for minor dependents of military and civilian personnel of the Department of Defense stationed in foreign countries. Authorizes the Board to utilize the services of other Federal agencies. States that functions vested in the Board which are now being performed by other Federal agencies shall be transferred to the Board.

titles.title: A bill to amend Public Law 874 of the 81st Congress to create within the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare a National Overseas Education Board having responsibility for the elementary and secondary education of certain overseas dependents.
